item.title: 日本央行发现各方对减少债券购买计划意见不一
item.description: 对于日本央行应该以多快的速度缩减购买政府债券的规模，市场参与者的看法大相径庭，有的人敦促加快削减步伐，有的人则主张放慢步伐。【原文：Market participants were widely split in their opinions on how fast the Bank of Japan should roll back its purchases of government bonds, with views ranging from those urging an acceleration of cutbacks to others advocating for slowdown.】

item.title: 中国铂金进口量创下一年来最高纪录，铂金供应紧张加剧
item.description: 上个月，中国珠宝商和投资者进口了一年来最多的铂金，因为这种贵金属的相对稳定性增强了它的吸引力，而不是飙升和波动的黄金。【原文：Chinese jewelers and investors imported the most platinum in a year last month, as the precious metal’s relative stability enhanced its attractiveness over surging and volatile gold.】

item.title: 印尼司机抗议提高薪酬，Grab、GoTo 成为众矢之的
item.description: Grab 控股有限公司和 GoTo 集团的叫车和送货服务将于周二在其最大的市场印度尼西亚中断，数万名司机准备就赔偿和其他条款进行抗议。【原文：Grab Holdings Ltd. and GoTo Group ride-hailing and delivery services are set to be disrupted on Tuesday in Indonesia, their biggest market, with tens of thousands of drivers preparing to protest over compensation and other terms.】

item.title: 匈牙利议员支持退出国际刑事法院
item.description: 匈牙利立法者批准退出国际刑事法院，巩固了维克托-欧尔班总理远离欧洲主流的又一举措。【原文：Hungarian lawmakers approved the exit from the International Criminal Court, cementing another move by Prime Minister Viktor Orban away from the European mainstream.】

item.title: 沃达丰预测德国扭亏为盈利润持平
item.description: 沃达丰集团（Vodafone Group Plc）预测本财年的盈利将大致持平，因为这家英国电信运营商在其主要的德国市场面临着日益激烈的竞争。【原文：Vodafone Group Plc forecast earnings in the current fiscal year will be approximately flat as the UK carrier faces increased competition in its key German market.】

item.title: 凯雷的鲁宾斯坦认为美国赤字是比贸易更大的问题
item.description: 凯雷集团联合创始人大卫-鲁宾斯坦（David Rubenstein）认为，解决美国不断扩大的财政赤字是一个比关税更大的问题，而关税很可能会在明年国会中期选举时淡出人们的视野。【原文：Tackling the widening US fiscal deficit is a bigger issue than tariffs, which are likely to fade from view by the time of the midterm elections in Congress next year, according to Carlyle Group Inc. co-founder David Rubenstein.】

item.title: 沙索首席执行官称化工股可能在 2030 年前上市
item.description: 沙索公司（Sasol Ltd.）首席执行官西蒙-巴洛伊（Simon Baloyi）表示，该公司的国际化工业务正在扭亏为盈，并可能在 "本十年末 "上市。【原文：Sasol Ltd. may list its international chemical business “towards the end of the decade,” following a turnaround of the business that’s underway, according to Chief Executive Officer Simon Baloyi.】

本田因需求低迷收回电动汽车投资和销售目标
item.description: 本田汽车公司缩减了电动汽车的投资计划并下调了销售目标，原因是消费者需求依然低迷，国外主要市场的环保法规也有所削弱。【原文：Honda Motor Co. scaled back investment plans and lowered sales targets for electric vehicles, as consumer demand remains lackluster and environmental regulations are weakened in major markets abroad.】

item.title: 马来西亚贸易在前沿货源的推动下跃升至近三年高点
item.description: 马来西亚的贸易额升至近三年来的新高，出口额超过了预期，出口活动呈现前负荷状态。【原文：Malaysia’s trade rose to an almost three-year high, with exports surpassing expectations amid front-loading activity.】

item.title: 沙索公司以更多可再生能源抵消煤炭消耗的策略
item.description: 沙索有限公司（Sasol Ltd.）计划满负荷运行其旗舰工厂，通过采购更多的可再生能源来抵消煤炭原料的使用，这是世界顶级煤炭合成燃料生产商改善业务战略的一部分。【原文：Sasol Ltd. plans to run its flagship plant at full capacity, offsetting the use of coal feedstock by sourcing more renewables as part of a strategy by the world’s top producer of synthetic fuel from coal to improve its business.】

item.title: 被制裁的俄罗斯北极液化天然气工厂正在使用新生产线
item.description: 俄罗斯位于北极地区的最新液化天然气工厂已开始使用第二条生产线，尽管该工厂仍受到西方国家的严格限制。【原文：Russia’s newest liquefied natural gas plant in the Arctic has begun using a second production line, even as the facility remains under stifling Western restrictions.】

item.title: 摩根大通和花旗银行认为欧洲股市几十年来跑赢美国股市的幅度最大
item.description: 一些华尔街策略师打赌，随着欧洲经济前景的改善，欧洲股市将迎来至少二十年来相对于美国股市的最佳表现。【原文：Some Wall Street strategists are betting European stocks will enjoy their best performance relative to the US in at least two decades as the region’s economic outlook improves.】

item.title: 外汇干预后港元融资成本下降
item.description: 在香港当局采取外汇干预措施后，香港主要银行间借贷成本大幅下滑，助长了对本地美元的看跌押注。【原文：Hong Kong’s key interbank borrowing cost slumped following foreign-exchange intervention by the city’s authorities, fueling bearish bets against the local dollar.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 "鸽派 "降息导致货币走低
item.description: 澳大利亚央行今年第二次下调了关键利率，同时在全球不确定性加剧的背景下对政策前景保持谨慎。【原文：Australia’s central bank lowered its key interest rate for a second time this year, while remaining cautious on the policy outlook against a backdrop of heightened global uncertainty.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为 "贸易战 "情景下失业率将升至 6% 附近
item.description: 澳大利亚央行警告说，在 "贸易战 "的情况下，美国将在2026年重新征收更高的 "解放日 "关税，所有国家都将采取报复行动，失业率将攀升至近6%。【原文：Australia’s central bank warned that the unemployment rate would climb to nearly 6% in a “trade war” scenario where the US re-imposes higher ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs in 2026 and all countries retaliate.】

item.title: 随着 Shein 和 Temu 的扩张，日本考虑对小包裹征税
item.description: 日本正在酝酿对包括中国在内的小包裹免税政策进行审查，与其他国家政府一道加强对Shein和PDD Holdings Inc's的Temu使用的免税渠道的审查。【原文：Japan is mulling a review of tax exemptions for small parcels including those shipped from China, joining a slew of governments stepping up scrutiny over a duty-free channel used by Shein and PDD Holdings Inc’s Temu.】

item.title: 沙特浆果是埃及私募股权基金的投资项目之一
item.description: 在沙特阿拉伯种植浆果和尼罗河畔的一个农业项目，是埃及主权财富基金前负责人联合创办的一家新私募股权公司的首批投资项目。【原文：Growing berries in Saudi Arabia and a farming project by the Nile are among the first investments of a new private equity firm co-founded by the former chief of Egypt’s sovereign wealth fund.】

item.title: 通货膨胀前景黯淡，尼日利亚将再次维持利率不变
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行的决策者们将在连续第二次会议上按兵不动，以更好地把握通货膨胀的轨迹。【原文：Policymakers at Nigeria’s central bank are set to keep the key interest rate on hold for a second straight meeting to get a better grasp of the inflation trajectory.】

item.title: 日本 20 年期债券拍卖获得 2012 年以来最弱需求
item.description: 日本 20 年期债券拍卖会的需求量为 2012 年以来最低，这表明市场担心在日本央行减持巨额债务的情况下谁会买入。【原文：Japan’s auction of 20-year bonds got the lowest demand since 2012, pointing to market concern about who will buy as the Bank of Japan dials back its huge debt holdings.】

item.title: 泰国希望通过出口规则削减 150 亿美元的美国贸易逆差
item.description: 泰国财政部长披差-春哈瓦吉拉（Pichai Chunhavajira）表示，通过最近采取的防止滥用出口原产地规则的举措，泰国预计每年将与美国的贸易差额减少多达 150 亿美元。【原文：Thailand expects to reduce its trade gap with the US by as much as $15 billion annually with its recent initiatives to prevent the misuse of origin rules for exports, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.】

item.title: Cathie Wood 买入近一年来最多的台积电存托凭证
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的基金购买了台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Cathie Wood’s funds made their biggest purchase of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares in nearly a year, underscoring a change in stance from being mostly sellers of the chipmaker since the third quarter of last year.】

item.title: 任天堂转向三星生产芯片，提高 Switch 2 产量
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co. Ltd.）已转向三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd.）帮助制造 Switch 2 的主芯片，此举可能有助于这家日本公司提高游戏机的产量，以便在 2026 年 3 月之前实现高于预期的 2000 万台销量。【原文：Nintendo Co. has turned to Samsung Electronics Co. to help make the main chips for the Switch 2, a move that may help the Japanese company ramp up production of the gaming console enough to sell a higher-than-projected 20 million units by March 2026.】

item.title: 特朗普批准 Perpetua 美国金锑矿的最终许可
item.description: 特朗普政府已为 Perpetua Resources 公司正在开发的一座金矿颁发了最后的联邦许可证，该金矿还拥有锑储量，锑是一种用于弹药的重要矿产。【原文：The Trump administration has granted the final federal permit for a gold mine being developed by Perpetua Resources Corp., which also has a reserve of antimony, a critical mineral used in munitions.】
